poem:
Title: "Austerity's Echo"

In the stark morning light,
Bared hands of the labourers reach,
For the bread that's not there.
Sharper, the cry of the hawk,
Warnings echo on walls –
Of banks and corporate halls,
Bitter as the winter's breath,
The furnace of profit cools.

Yet, even as we thirst,
In the grey austerity's pew,
Faith remains; stiff-necked,
Against the steel of the Budget's crucifix.
